adjective.description: (of a sentence) imposed by a judge or court but not enforced as long as no further offense is committed within a specified period.
examples: he was given a suspended prison sentence of 22 months

adjective.description: (of solid particles) dispersed through the bulk of a fluid.
examples: suspended sediments inhibit the sun's energy from being used for reef building

adjective.description: Supported by attachment from above; hanging.
examples: small vents in the suspended ceilings supply fresh air
suspended walkways and observation platforms high in the treetops
